item.title: Thrive Polygon Update: Aug 6th to Aug 12th üå±
item.dc:creator: ThrivePolygon
item.description:
Thrive Polygon Update: Aug 6th to Aug 12th

Earn from $50,000 in MATIC

In our last three weeks of Thrive Polygon, contributors can each earn $300 in MATIC for helping our grantees scale! We‚Äôve now launched our first 7 contributions from 5 grantees, and are set to double that this week. By the end of the week, the total pool of contributor rewards will exceed $50,000 in MATIC! Find them all here.

This week, we will be hosting a Polygon workshop with grantees, joining The Hangout X Space on Wed, Aug. 14 at 11 am ET (link) and connecting our grantees with Dabl.Club, Polygon‚Äôs leading builder community (link). We‚Äôre continuing to feature our grantees daily, including through our subject matter expert partner @Pukecast, so follow @ThrivePolygon on X/Twitter so you don‚Äôt miss out!

New Contributions

Earn between $1 to $20 in MATIC for completing any of these contributions. See them all announced on this X/Twitter thread!

  1. Kleo Network (@kleo_network) - Earn $4 in MATIC for minting your KLEO identity on Polygon https://thrive.polygon.technology/listings/1400
  2. Kleo Network (@kleo_network) - Earn up to $300 in MATIC for being on KLEO‚Äôs weekly leaderboard top 3 https://thrive.polygon.technology/listings/1399
  3. FANtium (@FANtiumOfficial) - Earn $2 in MATIC for joining the FANtium Fan Rewards Program and collecting 30 XPs https://thrive.polygon.technology/listings/1359
  4. FANtium (@FANtiumOfficial) - Earn up to $20 in MATIC by investing in Tennis Players on FANtium (non-US only)
    Gold - $20 in MATIC https://thrive.polygon.technology/listings/1386
    Silver - $10 in MATIC https://thrive.polygon.technology/listings/1385
    Bronze - $1 in MATIC https://thrive.polygon.technology/listings/1384
  5. NFC Wallet (@CitizenWallet) - Earn $100 in MATIC for setting up a community server with Citizen Wallet (NFC Wallet) https://thrive.polygon.technology/listings/1383
  6. Toaster Finance (@ToasterFinance) - Earn $5 in MATIC for collecting 100 Butter Points https://thrive.polygon.technology/listings/1348
  7. Reddit Community Currency (@RedditCurrency) - Earn $5 in MATIC for connecting to Reddit, using the faucet and posting about it on X https://thrive.polygon.technology/listings/1349

Find all the latest contributions at https://thrive.polygon.technology/seasons/polygon-season-1!

Social Media Buzz

We‚Äôre continuing our featured X posts on each grantee, posting testimonial videos from founders and top execs at each project, and bringing the vibes to Polygon. Here‚Äôs a sample from last week:

  • Video of Soe talking about @Intraverse: https://x.com/ThrivePolygon/status/1822998266234953797
  • Post on @WootzApp: https://x.com/ThrivePolygon/status/1822035493451710849
  • Video of Mathew talking about @SmartLayer: https://x.com/ThrivePolygon/status/1821689218017489121
  • Video of Jonathan talking about @FANtiumOfficial: https://x.com/ThrivePolygon/status/1820815551746216067
  • Post on @CallBackXYZ: https://x.com/ThrivePolygon/status/1820662378041614648

Catch Thrive Polygon on the X/Twitter-verse covering all things consumer crypto on Polygon. Here‚Äôs a list of our previous and upcoming spaces:

  • Summer Series: AI x Crypto (Fri, July 26th @ 10 am ET)
  • Polygon Space: Read. Set. Grants (Mon, July 29th @ 1 pm ET)
  • Summer Series: Gaming and Autonomous Worlds (Tue, July 30th @ 10 am ET)
  • ‚ÄúThe Aggregated‚Äù by QuickSwap (Fri, Aug. 2nd @ 11 am ET)
  • Summer Series: Digital/Physical Intersections (Mon, Aug. 5th @ 11 am ET)
  • Summer Series: NFT Innovation (Thu, Aug 8th @ 10 pm ET)
  • ‚ÄúThe Hangout‚Äù by De3ngineer (Wed, Aug. 14th @ 11 am ET)
  • Summer Series: Gamified Commerce, Content Co-Creation, Decentralized Social & Scenecoins (next week; time to be confirmed)

Look out for the first of our deep dive vlogs from Pukecast in the coming days!

Community Growth

We now have over 1,400 contributors to Thrive Polygon who have collectively completed almost 1,600 contributions. Most grantee contributions are updated weekly, so we‚Äôll see last week‚Äôs new contributions reflected later this week.

Stay Connected!

Join the Thrive Protocol Discord discord.gg/thriveprotocol, tune into our future spaces, and follow @thrivepolygon on X/Twitter (turn on notifications) to stay updated on all the exciting activities in the Thrive Polygon community.

Keep Thriving, Polygon!

1 post - 1 participant

item.title: Announcement : zkEVM Mainnet beta Update
item.dc:creator: obinna
item.description:
The team is excited to announce that starting tomorrow, 13th Aug, 2024 , cdk-erigon will be adopted as the official RPC for zkEVM Mainnet beta . This change will go into effect at 15:00 PM CEST/ 1:00 PM UTC .There‚Äôs no action required from infra providers, and we anticipate no downtime exceeding 5 minutes , starting tomorrow, 13th Aug, 2024, cdk-erigon will be the recommended RPC for zkEVM Mainnet beta, while the zkevm-node will also remain operational.

The recommended official versions are:
Legacy : v0.7.3
Erigon : v1.2.15.3

Although it is not mandatory to upgrade to these versions due to the change, it is advisable to use these versions.

2 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic

item.title: Bor v1.3.7 release
item.dc:creator: 0xsajal
item.description:
Hello All,

New version of Bor v1.3.7 have been released for both Polygon Mainnet and Polygon Amoy. It is a maintenance release and fixes few bugs compared with the last stable release (v1.3.6). It‚Äôs advisable to upgrade bor to this version at the earliest.

Steps for upgrading Bor node

  1. Stop bor service

    sudo service bor stop

  2. Install Bor with a version tag, network name (mainnet/amoy), and node type (sentry, validator, or archive).

    # Replace the node type
curl -L https://raw.githubusercontent.com/maticnetwork/install/main/bor.sh | bash -s -- v1.3.7 <network> <node_type>

  3. Check bor version

    /usr/bin/bor version

# It should print 
# v1.3.7

  4. Restart bor service

    sudo service bor start

Bor Changelog

What‚Äôs Changed

  • fix: eth/protocol: bunduled transactions are not broadcasted to the peers by @pratikspatil024 in #1296

Upstream Geth Merge

  • p2p/discover: unwrap 4-in-6 UDP source addresses (#29944) by @denniyooi3 in #1292
  • p2p/discover: add missing lock when calling tab.handleAddNode (#29960) by @pratikspatil024 in #1295

Misc

  • chore: fix some function names by @dufucun in #1257
  • README: Update discord link by @0xsajal in #1288
  • v1.3.4 Backport master to develop by @pratikspatil024 in #1294
  • v1.3.7 by @pratikspatil024 in #1305

Docker Images

You can find the latest docker images here:

Bor: https://hub.docker.com/r/0xpolygon/bor/tags

Heimdall:https://hub.docker.com/r/0xpolygon/heimdall/tags

Thanks,

Polygon Team

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic

item.title: POL Migration and Existing Contract?
item.dc:creator: Giri82
item.description:
While I understand the tokens in Polygon POS will be automatically converted from MATIC to POL.

With the POL migration coming up this September, will the mainnet RPC change? if yes, where will be the ledger for the old transactions and will it be migrated as well?
What will happen to the already deployed contract? Do we need to redeploy the contacts which are already live?

Also where is the testnet RPC endpoint for testing this. I am currently on AMOY testnet, does this have this change?

Need some clarity on this.

item.title: What're the technical steps behind the scenes to upgrade MATIC to POL on polygon?
item.dc:creator: apple999
item.description:
I understand for other chains that MATIC is on, people would need to migrate their MATIC by sending it to a migration contract.

However, I‚Äôm trying to understand how the MATIC is upgraded to POL on the Polygon POS chain from a technical perspective because it is the native gas token of the chain and not a erc20 token. I understand that users wouldn‚Äôt need to do anything and it would be upgraded automatically as stated here: https://polygon.technology/blog/save-the-date-matic-pol-migration-coming-september-4th-everything-you-need-to-know

Any insight would be appreciated.

5 posts - 3 participants

Read full topic

item.title: Bor v1.3.6 release
item.dc:creator: Parvez03
item.description:
Hello All,

We have released bor v1.3.6.

This release contains an important security fix on top of v1.3.4. It is recommended for everyone to upgrade their nodes to v1.3.6

Steps for upgrading Bor node

  1. Stop bor service

    sudo service bor stop

  2. Install Bor with a version tag, network name (amoy/mainnet), and node type (sentry, validator, or archive).

    # Replace the node type
curl -L https://raw.githubusercontent.com/maticnetwork/install/main/bor.sh | bash -s -- v1.3.6 <network> <node_type>

  3. Check bor version

    /usr/bin/bor version

# It should print 
# v1.3.6

  4. Restart bor service

    sudo service bor start

Bor Changelog

What‚Äôs Changed

  • v1.3.6 by @pratikspatil024 in #1302

Full Changelog: v1.3.4‚Ä¶v1.3.6

Docker Images

Bor: https://hub.docker.com/r/0xpolygon/bor/tags

Heimdall:https://hub.docker.com/r/0xpolygon/heimdall/tags

item.description:
I‚Äôve been experiencing issues with my Polygon wallet not syncing properly. After logging in and performing a few transactions, the wallet suddenly stops updating and doesn‚Äôt reflect the latest transactions or balances from which I bought the Nulls Brawl Apk website. I‚Äôve tried refreshing the page and even logging out and back in, but the problem persists. This issue seems to occur intermittently and affects both small and large transactions. Has anyone else encountered this problem, and what steps can be taken to resolve it?

item.title: Thrive Polygon Update: July 30th to Aug 5th üöÑ
item.dc:creator: ThrivePolygon
item.description:
Thrive Polygon Update: July 30th to Aug 5th

First Contributions Up

Just 3.5 more weeks in Thrive Polygon Season 1!

Last week, we launched our first two contributions that will help our grantees scale (Toaster Finance and Reddit Community Currency), hosted one Summer Series space (Gaming and Autonomous Worlds) and attended two others. In total, over 43,000 listeners tuned in!

This week, expect to see 10+ new contributions from more grantees as we ramp things up to help them scale (find them all at https://thrive.polygon.technology/seasons/polygon-season-1)! We will also be hosting two Summer Series spaces ‚Äì one on Digital/Physical Intersections and another on NFT Innovation. Our grantees are also getting plenty of time to shine ‚Äì follow @ThrivePolygon on X/Twitter so you don‚Äôt miss out!

New Contributions

Earn $5 in MATIC for completing either contribution::

  1. Toaster Finance (@ToasterFinance) - Connect on mobile, deposit in pools, swap or bridge and earn > 100 Butter Points https://thrive.polygon.technology/listings/1348
  2. Reddit Community Currency (@RedditCurrency) - Use the faucet to claim your first off-chain MATIC and share your experience on X/Twitter https://thrive.polygon.technology/listings/1349

Find all the latest contributions at https://thrive.polygon.technology/seasons/polygon-season-1!

Social Media Buzz

We had a huge week on X last week ‚Äì a whopping 43,000+ listeners joined us over three spaces as we talked grants, web3 and the future of consumer crypto on Polygon. On Mon, June 29th, we joined Polygon to talk about a few select grantees. Then, we hosted our Summer Series space on Gaming and Autonomous Worlds on Tue, June 30th. Finally, we closed out the week on QuickSwap‚Äôs 3-hour ‚ÄúThe Aggregated‚Äù show on Fri, Aug. 2nd featuring nearly half of our grantees!

This week, we‚Äôre hosting two more Summer Series spaces about Digital/Physical Intersections and NFT Innovation (at a later time to accommodate our frens in other time zones).

Join us over the next few weeks!

  • Summer Series: AI x Crypto (Fri, July 26th @ 10 am ET)
  • Polygon Space: Read. Set. Grants (Mon, July 29th @ 1 pm ET)
  • Summer Series: Gaming and Autonomous Worlds (Tue, July 30th @ 10 am ET)
  • ‚ÄúThe Aggregated‚Äù by QuickSwap (Fri, Aug. 2nd @ 11 am ET)
  • Summer Series: Digital/Physical Intersections (Mon, Aug. 5th @ 11 am ET)
  • Summer Series: NFT Innovation (Thu, Aug 8th @ 10 pm ET)
  • Summer Series: Gamified Commerce & Content Co-Creation (Mon, Aug. 12th @ 11 am ET)
  • Summer Series: Decentralized Social & Scenecoins (Thu, Aug. 15th @ 3 pm ET)

Additionally, we‚Äôre continuing our featured X posts on each grantee, posting videos from founders and top execs at each project, and bringing the vibes to Polygon. Look out for the first of our deep dive vlogs from Pukecast in the coming days!

Community Growth

We now have almost 1,300 contributors to Thrive Polygon who have collectively completed almost 1,450 contributions. Most grantee contributions are updated weekly, so we expect next week‚Äôs update will see these numbers grow significantly.

Stay Connected!

Join the Thrive Protocol Discord discord.gg/thriveprotocol, tune into our future spaces, and follow @thrivepolygon on X/Twitter (turn on notifications) to stay updated on all the exciting activities in the Thrive Polygon community.

Keep Thriving, Polygon!

item.title: Thrive Polygon Update: July 23rd to 29th üîä
item.dc:creator: ThrivePolygon
item.description:
Thrive Polygon Update: July 23rd to 29th

Preparing to Grow with Thrive Polygon

We are now 2/3 of the way through Thrive Polygon Season 1, which ends on August 31st. This week, we launch a slate of new contributions, some of which are specifically designed to help our grantees scale. We‚Äôre also running a full court press on marketing initiatives for our grantees, including a partnership with Pukecast, launching our Consumer Crypto Summer Series X Spaces, and taking part in Polygon community initiatives!

New Contributions

Last week, we launched three new short video (1 min or less) creator contributions for Thrive Polygon members to explain (1) their favorite consumer crypto project on Polygon, (2) their favorite Thrive Polygon grantee project, or (3) how to use the grantees‚Äô projects. Each video validated by our team of decentralized reviewers will earn a contributor $20 in MATIC!

We also launched an onboarding contribution for contributors to create a visual aid, such as an infographic, that explains how to get started with Thrive Polygon. Each validated contribution comes with a $10 in MATIC reward.

This week, we will be launching contributions for our Thrive Polygon Season 1 grantees, including Toaster Finance, Reddit Community Currency, potentially FANtium. Find all the latest contributions at https://thrive.polygon.technology/seasons/polygon-season-1!

Community Growth

We‚Äôve held off on our warchest of MATIC rewards until grantees have submitted their Thrive Polygon integration requests, which are starting to roll out this week. Look forward to some significant contributor and validated contribution growth in the coming weeks!

Pukecast Partnership

We‚Äôre excited to launch a major marketing initiative with our global subject matter expert (SME) partner, Pukecast, who will be creating and distributing top quality video content of our Thrive Polygon grantees. Get ready to hear from Pukecast as they dig deep into each project!

A few stats about Pukecast and its affiliate network:

Social Media Buzz

Last week, we started the first of six Spaces as part of our Consumer Crypto Summer Series, starting with our grantees in the AI x Crypto category on Fri, June 26th. Thrive Polygon, along with six of our grantees, also joined Polygon‚Äôs Space on grants on Mon, June 29th.

This Fri, Aug. 2nd, we will be joining a special edition of ‚ÄúThe Aggregated‚Äù at 11 am ET where all of our grantees will have an opportunity to get to know the QuickSwap community and the broader Polygon ecosystem.

Join us over the next few weeks!

  • Summer Series: AI x Crypto (Fri, July 26th @ 10 am ET)
  • Polygon Space: Read. Set. Grants (Mon, July 29th @ 1 pm ET)
  • Summer Series: Gaming and Autonomous Worlds (Tue, July 30th @ 10 am ET)
  • ‚ÄúThe Aggregated‚Äù by QuickSwap (Fri, Aug. 2nd @ 11 am ET)
  • Summer Series: Digital/Physical Intersections (Mon, Aug. 5th @ 11 am ET)
  • Summer Series: NFT Innovation (Thu, Aug 8th @ 10 pm ET)
  • Summer Series: Gamified Commerce & Content Co-Creation (Mon, Aug. 12th @ 11 am ET)
  • Summer Series: Decentralized Social & Scenecoins (Thu, Aug. 15th @ 3 pm ET)

Stay Connected!

Join the Thrive Protocol Discord discord.gg/thriveprotocol, tune into our future Spaces, and follow @thrivepolygon on X/Twitter (turn on notifications) to stay updated on all the exciting activities in the Thrive Polygon community.

Keep Thriving, Polygon!

What drew you to the world of blockchain and Web3?

Professional Background:
Please share a bit about your professional background and current occupation.
How do you see your skills and experiences contributing to your Web3 journey?

Interests in Web3:

Feature Recommendations:

Learning and Development:

Are there any resources or learning paths you‚Äôve found invaluable in your Web3 education that you‚Äôd like to share?

Community Engagement:

item.title: Introduction of Lapom
item.dc:creator: Lapom
item.description:
Basic Introduction:
What‚Äôs your name (or username), and where are you from?
Adrien GIrard
Marseille, France

What drew you to the world of blockchain and Web3?
I was fascinated by the potential of decentralization and how blockchain technology can reshape industries by providing transparency, security, and efficiency.

Professional Background:
Please share a bit about your professional background and current occupation.
How do you see your skills and experiences contributing to your Web3 journey?
I have a background in economics (academically), and currently, I am working as a web writer specializing in airdrops.

Interests in Web3:
What specific areas of Web3 are you most passionate about (e.g., DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, Gaming)?
Are there any projects or technologies in Web3 that you find particularly exciting or innovative?
I am most passionate about DeFi and DAOs because they represent a new way of financial interaction and governance, promoting inclusivity and innovation.

Feature Recommendations:
Have you or a friend ever experienced any pain points when using Polygon PoS? Or, do you have any exciting ideas for the chain you would like to voice?
If so, do you have any specific features/solutions you think would work well?
Implementing more efficient Layer 2 solutions and optimizing transaction batching could help mitigate high gas fees and improve user experience.

Current Projects:
Are you currently working on any Web3 projects? If so, please briefly overview what you‚Äôre working on.
How can the community support your projects? Are there specific collaborations or insights you‚Äôre seeking?
No

Learning and Development:
What challenges have you faced in the Web3 space, and how have you overcome them?
Are there any resources or learning paths you‚Äôve found invaluable in your Web3 education that you‚Äôd like to share?
One of the main challenges has been staying updated with the rapid pace of technological advancements. I overcome this by constantly engaging with the community, attending webinars, and participating in online courses.

Community Engagement:
How do you envision contributing to the Polygon Labs community?
Are you looking forward to participating in any discussions, events, or initiatives?
I plan to contribute by sharing my knowledge and experience through tutorials, participating in community discussions, and collaborating on open-source projects

Future Aspirations:
What are your long-term goals within Web3 and blockchain technology?
How do you see the future of blockchain evolving, and what role do you hope to play in it?
My long-term goal is to contribute to creating a decentralized financial ecosystem that is accessible to everyone, regardless of their background or location.

Fun Facts:
Share a fun fact about yourself or your hobbies outside of Web3.
Is there anything else you‚Äôd like the community to know about you?

    • Outside of Web3, I enjoy hiking and exploring new places. I am also an avid reader and enjoy learning about history and philosophy.

Connect and Collaborate:
How can other community members reach out to you for collaborations or discussions?
Are you looking for feedback, partners, or resources for your projects?
Twitter DM (@_Lapom)

item.title: Hello everyone I'm taro
item.dc:creator: katsuo
item.description:
Basic Introduction
What‚Äôs your name (or username), and where are you from?
I am Katsu Taro from Thailand.

What drew you to the world of blockchain and Web3?
Curiosity about blockchain, EVM, and DApps.

Professional Background
Please share a bit about your professional background and current occupation. How do you see your skills and experiences contributing to your Web3 journey?
I am currently a Web2 developer, but I am diving into Web3 with the intention of changing my occupation to that area.

Interests in Web3
What specific areas of Web3 are you most passionate about (e.g., DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, Gaming)?
I am particularly passionate about DAOs and DeFi.

Are there any projects or technologies in Web3 that you find particularly exciting or innovative?
I find DePIN and AI-driven solutions particularly exciting and innovative.

Feature Recommendations
Have you or a friend ever experienced any pain points when using Polygon PoS? Or, do you have any exciting ideas for the chain you would like to voice? If so, do you have any specific features/solutions you think would work well?
Not at the moment.

Current Projects
Are you currently working on any Web3 projects? If so, please briefly overview what you‚Äôre working on.
I am currently preparing projects for my portfolio to gain experience in Web3.

How can the community support your projects? Are there specific collaborations or insights you‚Äôre seeking?
Not yet

Learning and Development
What challenges have you faced in the Web3 space, and how have you overcome them?
Some Ethereum official website tutorials seem to be a little outdated.

Are there any resources or learning paths you‚Äôve found invaluable in your Web3 education that you‚Äôd like to share?
I find that some tutorials on the Ethereum official website are valuable despite being a bit outdated.

Community Engagement

item.title: Introduce by apao
item.dc:creator: supanutnew
item.description:
I am apao, and I am from Los Angeles, California. I was drawn to the world of blockchain and Web3 because of its potential to revolutionize industries and create new opportunities for innovation and collaboration.

I have a strong background in software development and currently work as a blockchain developer at a tech startup. My skills and experiences in programming and cryptography have prepared me to contribute to the Web3 journey by building secure and efficient decentralized applications.

I am most passionate about DeFi and NFTs in the Web3 space. I find the potential for decentralized finance to disrupt traditional banking systems and the creativity of non-fungible tokens to be particularly exciting and innovative.
